projects.title: All in One Tool kit for Freelancer
projects.description: What problem does it solve, or what inspired you to build it? I built Creldesk because freelancers often waste time jumping between multiple tools for editing, creating proposals, building resumes, managing invoices, and handling small productivity tasks. Instead of opening five different websites, I wanted to create an all-in-one workdesk that puts everything in one place. The inspiration came from the everyday struggles of freelancers who need speed, organization, and reliability to get client work done efficiently.  Who is it for? Creldesk is designed for freelancers, remote workers, and students who need a clean, professional, and centralized dashboard for their daily tasks. Whether someone is editing visuals, writing proposals, or managing documents, Creldesk provides the essential tools in one platform.  Key Features & Functionality  Editors: Embedded Photopea editor, functional Logo Editor (with export options), Resume Builder (PDF export, AI-generated sections), Proposal Generator, and Invoice Generator.  Productivity Tools: PDF Compressor, Screen Recorder, File Converter (images and documents), and Audio Visualizer.  Utilities: QR Code Generator, Password Generator, Color Picker, and Pomodoro Timer.  Design & Usability:  Professional Apple-style dark mode UI with turquoise accents  Collapsible sidebar with categories (Editors, Productivity, Tools)  Responsive design for desktop, tablet, and mobile  Fully functional tools (no placeholders)  Integrations: Uses iframes for embedded apps like Photopea, and custom-coded JavaScript/Tailwind for built-in tools such as the resume builder, logo editor, and file utilities.

projects.title: IDMind
projects.description: IDMind is an AI-powered KYC (Know Your Customer) verification system that prevents identity fraud by analyzing selfie videos in real time. It detects deepfakes, physical spoofing (e.g. masks, fake limbs), and liveness failures using a combination of computer vision models and heuristic logic.  What makes IDMind unique is its ability to turn raw detection outputs into human-readable fraud reports using an integrated Large Language Model (LLM). This means compliance teams get clear, explainable reasons behind a “pass” or “flag” decision — not just raw scores.  It’s built for fintechs, crypto platforms, banks, and any digital platform that requires video-based user onboarding.

projects.title: AutoBoss: Build Your AI Agency in Minutes
projects.description: Hey! So I'm Lakshya, just turned 18 and still figuring out this whole "adulting" thing while finishing high school. Got obsessed with AI after falling down way too many YouTube rabbit holes (probably should've been studying lol). The Problem That Drove Me Crazy: I really wanted to start something with AI - like, I had all these ideas but every single tool I looked at was either $200+ per month or required me to basically become a programmer overnight. I'm decent with computers but come on, I'm not trying to spend 6 months learning Python just to build a simple chatbot. It felt like being the only person without a driver's license trying to get somewhere. What I Built: AutoBoss is basically what I wished existed when I started - a no-code way for regular people to create AI stuff and actually make money from it. Think of it as training wheels for starting an AI agency, but the training wheels actually work really well. Who It's For: Anyone who's curious about AI but doesn't want to become a developer. I'm thinking freelancers who want to add AI services, small business owners, people in their 20s-40s who are tech-curious but not tech-experts. Basically people like my mom who can use Canva but would run away screaming from GitHub. What It Actually Does:  Client Workspaces - keeps your projects organized instead of having 47 browser tabs open AI Employee Builder - you can make chatbots or data analysis tools (added some badges because why not make it fun?) Document Training - upload PDFs or paste website URLs to teach your AI stuff Easy Sharing - send clients their AI tools through simple links  I built it mostly with Bolt.new (which is amazing btw), Firebase for the backend stuff, and Next.js. Did most of the coding between 11pm-2am because that's when my brain actually works. The Cool Part: In June, I got some people to test it and they were building working AI solutions in like 10-15 minutes. One person made a chatbot for a local bakery that actually helped them res

Bag Manager makes it easy to build, simulate, and refine your bag online. Create your current setup, test alternate bags, swap discs in and out, and quickly spot gaps in your coverage. projects.description: Veritas is your Intelligent Behavioral Trading Coach, built to solve the #1 reason traders fail: emotional self-sabotage and execution flaws. Veritas takes your trade chart and rationale, then provides a brutal, data-driven critique of your emotional biases (like FOMO or revenge trading) and execution errors. projects.title: Awaken
projects.description: Awaken was born from one core frustration: self-help often feels boring, inconsistent, or overwhelming. Especially for young men who grew up on anime, games, and the internet. We wanted to build something better. A system that makes personal growth feel like leveling up your character, not checking off chores.  Most people already know what they should do. Go to the gym. Save money. Stay focused. But knowing isn’t the problem. The real struggle is staying consistent without structure, feedback, or a sense of momentum.  Awaken turns self-development into an RPG.  It gives each user daily AI-generated quests based on their goals across fitness, wealth, mindset, and relationships. Completing quests earns EXP, levels up their anime-style avatar, and drives real-world growth. Avatars are generated from selfies and evolve as the user does.  Core features include quest streaks, ranking systems, guilds, and optional social media locks for missed goals. Every detail is designed to feel like story-driven progress — not just productivity.  Who it’s for: Ambitious young adults who want more from life but are tired of generic advice. Especially men aged 16 to 33 who grew up immersed in anime, gaming, and online culture. They don’t want a boring checklist. They want a system that speaks their language.  Awaken is not just another app. It is an identity builder, a discipline engine, and a culture in the making. We are reimagining what it means to grow.

projects.title: Impact Taps
projects.description: I wanted to explore whether a simple interactive experience could leave a lasting emotional impact. We’re constantly surrounded by statistics about war, climate change, and social issues, but they often feel distant or abstract. I wondered—what if we could sneak that awareness in through something unexpected?  Impact Taps looks like a game at first. You tap for 10 seconds, thinking it's about speed or reflexes. But when the timer ends, you’re shown your score as a real-world statistic—like the number of children killed in conflict zones last year, or the amount of plastic dumped into the ocean every day. The surprise makes people stop and think. That’s the goal.  This was built entirely using one prompt on Bolt.new. The app uses JavaScript to track taps, a 10-second timer, and a simple local JSON file filled with verified statistics. No backend, no fancy logic. Just a clean interface and one strong emotional reveal.  Impact Taps is for anyone who scrolls the web mindlessly and needs a moment of perspective. It’s quick, frictionless, and designed to catch people off guard—in a good way.

projects.title: Video Prompt Crafter
projects.description: Creating high quality AI generated videos is both time consuming and expensive. Crafting the perfect prompt often requires multiple iterations, and generic prompts typically focus only on basic elements like the subject and environment while ignoring critical cinematic aspects such as camera angles, shot types, lighting, and visual effects.  As video generation becomes more mainstream, creators need a smarter way to build rich and detailed prompts that translate into visually compelling results.   I took a cinematic scene and reverse-engineered it, breaking it down into key components:  Character & Action – including Age, Subject, Emotion, and Activity. Environment & Atmosphere – such as Location, Time of Day, and Mood. Cinematic Details – like Camera Shot Type, Movement, and Angle. Visuals & Tone – covering Lighting, Aesthetics, VFX, Color Palette, Audio, and Resolution. Dialogue – for adding spoken elements.  By filling in these guided inputs, you’re essentially crafting a complete cinematic scene—one that’s ready to be copied directly into AI video generation platforms for high-quality output.

projects.title: OnceUponATime Stories
projects.description: OnceUponATime Stories is a web platform that lets any parent turn a simple photo of their child’s favourite object into a fully illustrated, narrated children’s book.  Problem & Inspiration Kids’ endless “Why?” questions deserve more than generic search results. I wanted a way to give my daughter answers she’d remember-wrapped in a story starring her own toy.  Who it’s for Busy parents (and teachers) who want personalised, age-appropriate stories that engage, educate and delight.  Key features & flow Snap & Style – Upload a photo; pick an art style. A consistent main character is auto-generated. Outline – Enter title, moral, age group, page count; the app creates a full table of contents. Story – expands the outline into an age-appropriate narrative. Illustrations – produce a matching image for each page, reusing the character. projects.title: Mamabase - AI Parenting Companion
projects.description: Mamabase is an emotionally intelligent AI companion designed to support parents through everyday parenting challenges. Inspired by my own experience raising two young kids, I noticed that stories helped my older child process big emotions better than lectures — but finding the right story in the moment wasn’t always easy.  Mamabase solves this by taking a real-life parenting situation (like sibling jealousy or tantrums) and generating a personalized, age-appropriate story — complete with a teaching moment and a printable illustration — to help children understand and cope.  Built for busy parents, Mamabase features:  A warm AI agent that reflects back emotional insight  A customizable “StoryCoach” experience with user-selected style and tone  Integration with OpenAI (via Bolt) and Supabase (auth & storage)  Example prompt from the user: “My 4-year-old melts down when it’s time to leave the park.”  Mamabase replies with emotional reflection, parenting support, and a unique story to share with the child — all in under a minute.

projects.description: Ramp is an AI-powered onboarding companion for product managers, built to help you gain clarity, get structure, and start delivering value from day one.  I built it because I lived the problem. On my first day as a PM intern, I was handed a product with no documentation, no onboarding, and no real support. Three years and many mentorship conversations later, I realized this is still the norm — especially in fast-paced startups.  Ramp brings structure to those chaotic first weeks. It gives you:  A tailored 3-week onboarding checklist  A real-world “Ask a PM” AI assistant  A library of ready-to-use templates  I built Ramp in a single AI prompt using Bolt, styled with TailwindCSS and powered by GPT-4o logic (coming). It’s fully responsive, requires no login, and is designed for real-world PM struggles — the kind no one prepares you for.  If it helps even one PM feel less lost in their first 90 days, it’s done its job.

projects.title: ParkRanker
projects.description: Everyone has a different “Top 10 U.S. National Parks” list—Google shows dozens, none agree, and none explain why. ParkRanker crowdsources the answer.  Built for outdoor enthusiasts and trip-planners, the app serves two random parks, lets users click their favorite, and instantly updates a chess-style ELO leaderboard. Key features:  Head-to-head voting loop (no login needed)  Real-time rankings and “trending” movers  1-line park summaries generated by ChatGPT-4  Data scraped from Wikipedia via Apify, stored in Supabase  Bolt.new handles UI, serverless ELO math, and feeds Netlify for deployment (custom Entri/IONOS domain).  Core prompt: “Present two random National Parks from the database with name, photo, and one-line summary. On click, record the vote, update ELO scores for both parks, and refresh the leaderboard.

projects.title: Symbione - Feel The World Emotions
projects.description: Symbione was born out of emotional exhaustion, not excitement. While the world faced crisis after crisis—from the unrest in Manipur to global tragedies—there was no platform that truly captured the emotional state of the world. News overwhelmed us but never asked: how does the world feel right now?  We built Symbione for those who want more than just headlines, for those who want to feel the news, not just read it.  What makes it special?  Symbione maps global news into a 3D emotional space using AI, sentiment analysis, and data from platforms like Reddit, grouped by emotions like joy, fear, anger, and hope. It’s not just a feed; it’s a visual, emotional landscape. Users can explore stories, save them to the Cosmark (an AI-powered research space), and interact with an emotional assistant for deeper understanding.  Symbione is for the emotionally curious, the thinkers, the feelers, the ones seeking connection in a disconnected world.

projects.description: MyParu solves the problem of cold, reactive AI by creating four distinct AI companions with unique personalities who proactively help with your daily life. Instead of one generic assistant, you get Neon (energetic fitness buddy), Ramuda (calm productivity optimizer), Nekoko (playful travel curator), and Ramune (competitive gaming companion) who work together as your personal support team. projects.title: CondoShield
projects.description: Special assessments often catch property owners off guard—large, unexpected fees with little transparency or legal recourse. As a condo owner myself, I’ve been affected—and continue to be impacted—by questionable special assessments resulting in substantial additional monthly payments. I found it difficult to understand these charges, know my rights, or connect with others in similar situations. That frustration sparked CondoShield—an AI-powered online platform accessible on the web with seamless, interactive support on mobile browsers that empowers owners to understand, track, and challenge special assessments with confidence.

projects.title: Wheely
projects.description: Wheely was inspired by the growing need for flexible, short-term urban mobility across multiple vehicle types. In many cities, users are forced to rely on separate apps for bikes, scooters, or cars—or commit to expensive long-term rentals. Wheely solves this by offering an all-in-one platform where users can rent bicycles, scooters, motorbikes, and cars on an hourly basis. Designed for tourists, students, gig workers, and daily commuters, it allows users to browse nearby vehicles, select rental duration, and return them at designated drop zones. The app is built using React Native with Expo Router for seamless navigation, Lucide Icons for a clean UI, and Django Rest Framework on the backend. Key features include dynamic ride selection, intuitive modals, multi-language support, and a responsive UI for both Android and iOS. We also designed the system to be scalable—ready for future integrations like GPS tracking, payments, referral programs, and even a unique Subletting feature where users can share unused rental time with others. With Wheely, we’re redefining short-term transportation as smarter, more flexible, and community-driven.

projects.title: Focus Room

Inspired by my personal struggle juggling multiple jobs, I wanted to create a tool that makes focus feel rewarding, not forced.  Users can start solo or group sessions, earn tokens, and receive nudges from an AI voice assistant called FocusBot. Built with Bolt, Supabase, and Daily.co, FocusRoom offers a clean UI, customizable timers, and progress analytics—perfect for students, remote workers, or anyone trying to build strong focus habits.

projects.title: Aven
projects.description: Aven is your AI-powered personal assistant designed to actually get things done. Instead of juggling multiple apps, you can manage your email, calendar, documents, and even web research through simple voice or chat commands — as naturally as delegating tasks to a real assistant. Powered by ElevenLabs AI for real-time conversations and integrated with PicaOS for secure access to Gmail, Calendar, Docs, and Sheets, Aven simplifies productivity into one intuitive experience.  We built Aven with a sleek Next.js interface, Supabase for real-time features and secure data handling, and Stripe for precise, usage-based billing. Along the way, we tackled challenges like AI timeouts, secure token deduction, and Supabase's security quirks — all while refining a clean, mobile-friendly UI that builds user trust. Aven merges powerful backend logic with effortless usability, so your AI assistant just works.

projects.title: Will AI Replace Me? - Find out in seconds
projects.description: WillAIReplaceMe.io tells you, in under 10 seconds, how at risk your job is from AI.  In a time when careers are being reshaped overnight, people are anxious about what comes next. This tool gives them instant clarity. No jargon. No guesswork. Just a fast, personalised breakdown of how safe their job is, which skills are vulnerable, and where to focus next.  It’s built around what might be the question of our generation: “Will AI replace me?”  It helps users:  Regain a sense of control in uncertain times,  Avoid wasting time learning the wrong things,  Make smarter and more confident career moves,  and spot risks early before it’s too late to adapt . The platform is for anyone worried about AI, from professionals and students to companies preparing their teams for the future.  Because in a world changing this fast, waiting to react is the biggest risk of all.

projects.title: BloodLink - An AI - Powered Blood Donation Platform
projects.description: BloodLink – AI-Powered Global Blood Donation Platform  Every day, lives are lost not because treatment isn’t available — but because a matching blood donor can’t be found in time. I’ve witnessed this pain firsthand in Pakistan and across APAC: desperate social media posts begging for rare blood types. That’s why I built BloodLink — a solo-developed, AI-powered platform to solve this problem globally.  🔍 What It Does:  Instantly matches patients with compatible blood donors worldwide  Uses smart compatibility logic (Exact > Universal > Compatible)  Real-time donor filtering with availability badges  Supports 195+ countries and 20+ languages  Features KhoonBuddy – a voice AI chatbot powered by ElevenLabs  Maps nearby blood banks using OpenStreetMap & Overpass API  Fully responsive frontend (React + TailwindCSS)  Backed by Supabase with secure RLS and smart eligibility logic  Deployed on Netlify, proudly Built on Bolt.new  🚀 Whether it’s a patient in Lahore, Jakarta, or Nairobi — BloodLink helps find a donor fast, intelligently, and globally.

projects.title: PurpleVerse
projects.description: 💡What problem does it solve, or what inspired you to build it? Who is it for?  PurpleVerse was inspired by the frustrating limitations people in low-income countries face when shopping online — especially when it comes to international payments, FOREX instability, and platform restrictions. Traditional e-commerce is often inaccessible or expensive for users in these regions, and that creates a digital divide in global trade.  I wanted to solve this by creating a borderless e-commerce platform that leverages crypto (USDC on Algorand Testnet for the prototype) as the means of payment. This removes the need for traditional financial systems and enables secure, trustless transactions worldwide — even for physical goods.  PurpleVerse is for:  Buyers who want to shop globally without payment restrictions.  Sellers looking to reach wider markets and access intelligent tools.  Emerging markets underserved by mainstream payment systems.   🔑 Key Features & Functionality  Crypto-Powered Payments Secure, escrow-based crypto transactions using USDC on Algorand. Funds are held until buyers confirm delivery.  Mock Wallet Integration For demo purposes, a hardcoded mock wallet simulates crypto payments and release flows.  AI-Assisted Seller Tools Sellers get help writing product descriptions, tracking analytics, and managing inventory through AI-powered features.  Admin Dashboard Full control panel to manage users, roles, featured products, commissions, and blog content.  Flash Sales & Featured Listings Sellers can run time-limited offers or pay to boost product visibility across the platform.  Platform Revenue Model 5% commission on every sale + featured product placement fees, all automated.  Blog and AI Chatbot (Support) Includes a built-in blog CMS and AI chatbot to assist buyers and sellers with FAQs and navigation.   🔌 Built With:  Frontend: React + TypeScript + Tailwind + Vite  Backend: Supabase (auth, DB, storage, functions, RLS)  Blockchain: Algorand (Testnet) using algo

projects.title: Battle Prompt

Then I decided that it would be better to educate people in a way that will make them better prompters instead of copy-pasting, and even better - learn new topics along the way. This is where the idea of creating a gamified website came about. I wanted to have an engaging experience while the user is trying to prompt his way out of a debate which will purposefully reward him with new knowledge in a certain category.

On the other hand, apps that focused on form and accuracy were mind-numbingly boring and hard to stick with.  I kept asking myself: "Why isn't there a typing app that's both fun and technically effective?" That question became the spark for TYPE INVADER.  What if the only way to save Earth from destruction was to type... perfectly?

projects.title: Bryge AI - Your AI for ADHD communication
projects.description: As a neurotypical person, I’ve watched friends and coworkers with ADHD navigate a world that wasn’t built for their communication style, seeing the constant friction and immense mental effort it took to process a simple wall of text. The burden was always on them to adapt, and that didn’t sit right with me. I wanted to flip that script and build a bridge, which is why I created BRYGE AI. It’s an AI-powered communication assistant for any neurotypical person—a manager, a friend, or a partner—who wants to connect more thoughtfully and effectively with the ADHD minds in their life. It goes far beyond grammar checkers to fundamentally reshape how a message is crafted and emotionally received. First, it acts as a personal coach, intelligently analyzing your original message for hidden pressure words and emotional triggers. Then, it transforms dense text into clean, emotionally safer language that you can customize with different tones and intents. Its standout feature, powered by ElevenLabs, is the ability to generate a personalized voice note in your own voice, which lowers the cognitive load for the recipient and eliminates the cold, robotic feel of other AI tools. Ultimately, BRYGE AI doesn’t just fix one message—it teaches you how to communicate better, helping you build the lasting habits of clarity, kindness, and emotional intelligence that reshape all your relationships.

projects.title: Project Run
projects.description: Project Run is a decentralized emergency response protocol designed for a world where centralized communication channels can fail. It was sparked by a single, chilling question: What happens when you can no longer trust the information you receive—or receive no information at all?  This functional prototype, built for the Bolt.new Hackathon, transforms any smartphone into a node in a peer-powered safety network. It's built for communities, enabling them to send, receive, and verify critical alerts without relying on central servers.  Key Features: - A full-stack application with a live Supabase backend for real-time alerts. - A multi-page dashboard for threat monitoring and reporting. - A community-based verification system to combat misinformation. - A "Trusted Circle" interface for personal network management.  The entire project, from concept and UI design to the full-stack integration, was built in under 72 hours through an intensive human-AI collaboration using Bolt.new, Gemini, and other AI tools.

projects.title: Street Art Tour
projects.description: Street Art Tour City The Problem: Urban exploration can feel disconnected and directionless. Cities are filled with incredible street art that often goes unnoticed, while tourists and locals alike struggle to discover authentic cultural experiences beyond typical attractions. Traditional tours are expensive and inflexible, operating on rigid schedules that don't accommodate spontaneous exploration. Our solution is an SMS-based scavenger hunt that guides users through urban street art discoveries. The platform uses Twilio for text messaging interactions and Supabase for secure authentication. Users explore cities through graffiti pieces and locations stored in our database, unlocking new experiences at their own pace. We're building organic reach through automatically generated blog content based on our cataloged street art and partnerships. Our partnership pages are already ranking well in Google searches, creating a sustainable growth channel. The platform is fully monetized with Stripe integration for seamless payments. The concept was inspired by a personal experience exploring historic buildings in London, but evolved to focus specifically on street art to create a more vibrant, contemporary urban adventure.

projects.title: Melodia

Many learners struggle to stay motivated, remember new words, or use Spanish confidently in real conversations.  Who is it for? This platform is designed for anyone who wants to learn Spanish in a fun, modern, and immersive way. Key Features, Functionality, and Integrations:  AI-Generated Music: Our app creates unique Spanish songs with catchy rhythms and authentic lyrics, making language learning engaging and memorable.  Interactive Practice: Users can practice pronunciation, test their vocabulary, and complete listening exercises directly from the song lyrics. The platform should feature interactive lyrics, real-time translations, vocabulary games, and an AI chat tutor, all accessible on web and mobile. projects.title: AG-42 Racing Book - 1/4 de milla
projects.description: “Introducción al 1/4 de milla argentino” es un e-book pensado para cubrir la falta de material especializado en español y adaptado al contexto local sobre esta disciplina del automovilismo.  Problema que resuelve / Inspiración En Argentina existen muy pocos recursos accesibles para quienes quieren iniciarse en el mundo del cuarto de milla: la información está dispersa en foros, videos y manuales en inglés, sin un recorrido pedagógico que guíe paso a paso a principiantes. Me inspiró mi propia experiencia como corredor aficionado y la pasión de la comunidad local, para condensar todo en un sólo manual claro y práctico.  Público objetivo – Aficionados y entusiastas del drag racing que recién comienzan. – Pilotos de calle y clubes de automóviles que quieran profesionalizar su preparación. – Talleres y preparadores que busquen una guía básica de referencia.  Características clave  Historia y contexto local: evolución del cuarto de milla en pistas argentinas, anécdotas y referencias a eventos destacados.  Guías prácticas: desde la elección del vehículo y sus componentes (suspensión, neumáticos, transmisión) hasta ajustes básicos de motor e inyección.  Electrónica aplicada: conceptos de mapas de ECU, uso de sensores (TPS, RPM, temperatura), y ejemplos de configuración semisecuencial.  Técnicas de conducción: staging, launch control, manejo de la tracción y los cambios para optimizar el crono.  Seguridad y normativa: checklist de equipamiento obligatorio, permisos y reglamentos de pista.  Recursos adicionales: plantillas de registro de tiempos, códigos QR a tutoriales en video y enlaces a proveedores argentinos.

projects.title: CleanScan
projects.description: CleanScan turns any smartphone into a pocket nutritionist. After spending 45-minute grocery runs Googling obscure additives for my daughter’s allergies—and my own post-mold-toxicity diet—I built an app that vet ingredients in a single tap.  Problem it solves Decoding food labels is tedious, inconsistent, and risky for anyone with allergies or dietary restrictions. CleanScan automates that legwork, instantly flagging problem ingredients and suggesting healthier substitutes.  Who it’s for • Parents managing kids’ food allergies • “Clean-eating” shoppers avoiding seed oils, dyes, etc. • Fitness or medical professionals who need quick label audits  Key features & integrations 	•	Live OCR + Barcode Scan – Tesseract.js captures ingredient lists; fallback UPC lookup coming. 	•	Personalized Profiles – store allergies, dietary goals, and “avoid” lists. 	•	CleanScore Engine – OpenAI o4-mini parses text, maps aliases (“rapeseed ≠ canola”), ranks product cleanliness, and flags synthetics. 	•	Cleaner Alternatives – AI suggests in-stock substitutes, one-tap add to a sharable shopping list. 	•	Privacy-First Analytics – Supabase auth and RLS keep scans private while anonymized ingredient hashes power trend dashboards. 	•	Netlify + React/Vite PWA – installs like an app, works offline for repeated scans.  Prompt example: “Parse this ingredient list and return JSON: {ingredients[], flagged[], cleanScore, topAlternatives[]}”

projects.title: Retro Mobile Snake Clone: Pixel-Perfect LCD Grid
projects.description: The Nokia 3310 from the early 2000s was my first taste of mobile gaming. I spent dozens of hours playing Snake on my father’s phone. I wanted to recreate that feeling in a single prompt for the Oneshot Challenge. Building the basic Snake game was the easy part, the real challenge was designing the layout and pixel font to match the retro style, all within a single prompt and without needing follow-ups. I’d like to add that, although I work as a project manager, I have very limited hands-on experience with programming and Bolt honestly feels like magic.  I'll gladly share the prompt via DM on X (https://x.com/kolar_eth)  What it does Recreates Snake on an 84 × 48 grid of 8 px divs Arrow keys/WASD + space-to-start Authentic LCD “jitter” (0.5 px gaps) Retro beeps (Web Audio API) Score rendered in a 5 × 5 pixel font outside the grid How I built it React + TypeScript inside Bolt.new Tailwind CSS grid utilities only—no <canvas> Game loop via setInterval, food blink via requestAnimationFrame Modular components: GameGrid.tsx, ScoreDisplay.tsx, Overlay.tsx Challenges Keeping pixel gaps intact after CSS transforms Syncing score font with un-scaled grid pixels Accomplishments Zero images/SVG—100 % div-driven graphics

projects.title: MoldMend
projects.description: MoldMend is a web-based recovery companion for people suffering from mold-related illness—a condition that often leaves patients juggling scattered PDFs, spreadsheets, and guesswork. Inspired by my own 2020 battle with mold toxicity, the app unifies everything a user needs in one dashboard: 	•	Smart Assessment – a quick intake scores exposure history and current symptoms, seeding an AI-tailored recovery protocol (binders, diet tweaks, lifestyle habits). 	•	Dynamic Daily Checklist – completion rings and reminders keep users consistent. 	•	Symptom Tracker – preset sliders + free-text inputs log severity and automatically chart progress. 	•	AI Insights – nightly OpenAI o4-mini jobs (via Supabase Edge cron) analyze trends and suggest protocol tweaks (“increase charcoal binder dose,” “add sauna sessions”). 	•	Evidence Library – curated papers, recipes, and doctor-approved videos appear contextually as users log issues. 	•	One-click Physician PDF – serverless Puppeteer generates a compressed report users can email to their practitioner.  Built with React/Vite, Supabase (auth, row-level security, storage), Recharts/Tailwind for visuals, and Netlify for zero-ops deployment, MoldMend turns a confusing, multi-month healing journey into clear, data-driven steps—helping sufferers breathe easier, regain energy, and reclaim their lives.

WhatsApp Integration: Facilitates direct communication with customers for sending payment proofs or requesting bank transfer details, enhancing customer service. Responsive Design: Built with React and Tailwind CSS, ensuring a consistent and appealing user experience across various devices. Supabase Integration: Used for user authentication and managing user profiles, providing a secure backend for user data. SEO Optimization: Includes comprehensive meta tags in index.html for better search engine visibility.

projects.title: LifeBeacon Rescue/Civil
projects.description: LifeBeacon revolutionizes emergency rescue by transforming smartphones into life-saving beacons for trapped victims during disasters. The Problem: In 2024, 10,000+ people died under rubble after earthquakes and building collapses. Current rescue methods using dogs, thermal cameras, or manual searching are often too slow during the critical first 48 hours when every minute counts. The Solution: A dual-app emergency system creating direct communication between trapped victims and rescue teams. Nearly everyone carries a powerful beacon - their smartphone. LifeBeacon unlocks this potential to dramatically reduce search time. LifeBeacon Civil (for civilians - https://serene-kelpie-605da4.netlify.app/):  Automatic emergency signals when app installed Large stress-resistant SOS button for conscious victims Receives wake commands from rescue teams Optimized battery management for extended operation under debris Discreet mode for dangerous situations  LifeBeacon Rescue (complementary app for emergency responders):  Real-time radar detection of civilian signals Advanced filtering by priority, battery level, and distance Remote wake commands to trigger sounds/vibrations on victim phones Team coordination and mission management  Key Innovation: Creates a direct communication bridge between trapped victims and rescue teams, potentially saving thousands of lives through technology everyone already carries. Built with Bolt.new by a first-time developer in 3 days, proving that determination and AI-powered development can create life-saving solutions.

projects.title: SuperArc - AI powered Study Platform
projects.description: Inspiration As students, we often find ourselves distracted while studying — especially when switching between our e-materials, YouTube, and AI tools. A simple task like understanding a concept quickly becomes a rabbit hole of distractions.  We wanted a solution that lets students upload their study material and stay locked in — learning, asking AI questions, and watching only the right videos — all in one focused space. That’s how SuperArc was born:  An AI-powered, distraction-free study platform that helps students focus deeply and build their comeback arc.  What it does SuperArc is a productivity-first platform designed for students and self-learners. It lets users:  Upload PDFs, notes, or any study materials Use AI to ask questions contextually based on their material Get YouTube video suggestions relevant to the topic they're reading Summarize long content instantly Auto-generate flashcards after each topic Study in Pomodoro mode with streak tracking and gamified progress Unlock badges like "Ignition" and "Locked In" based on study discipline All of this happens within a dark-mode, focused workspace — built to help users stay in the zone.  How we built it We designed and built the UI with:  React.js for the front end ShadCN for clean, modern UI components Supabase for authentication and file storage Gemini API for contextual AI chat, summaries, and topic detection YouTube Data API for fetching educational videos based on extracted content We also built modular sections:  A reading pane for uploaded materials AI assistant chat Flashcard tab Video suggestion tab A focus timer with built-in badge reward logic Challenges we ran into Accurately extracting readable text from PDF documents in various formats Making AI responses strictly context-aware (based on the uploaded material only) Suggesting YouTube videos that are actually relevant and educational — not just clickbait Designing the experience to feel motivational but not overwhelming Accomplishments that we're

projects.title: AI Snax
projects.description: As someone who works full-time and loves staying up to date with AI research, I found it nearly impossible to keep up with all the new papers coming out. Most papers are dense, and YouTube explainers are long and time-consuming. I wanted something that would let me learn while doing other things—whether I'm walking, commuting, or at the gym.  That’s what inspired me to build AI Snax. It’s designed for busy professionals, curious learners, students, and even AI enthusiasts who want to stay sharp without having to carve out focused reading time. The app delivers short, 2–3 minute audio podcasts that break down recent AI papers into digestible bites.  Users can scroll through podcast cards, listen on the go, save favorites, and even view the original paper on arXiv if they want to dive deeper. On the backend, I integrated ElevenLabs to generate high-quality voice narration, Supabase for authentication and user profiles, and Netlify for seamless deployment. Admin users can upload transcripts or trigger podcast generation with just a few clicks.  It’s a simple idea, but the impact is real—turn passive time into learning time, without adding more to your to-do list.

projects.title: Open World Map – Call for Heroes
projects.description: In 2020, during the peak of the COVID-19 pandemic, I saw how many people silently struggled — needing help but unable or afraid to ask for it. Meanwhile, others wanted to help but had no idea who needed support or where to go.  That’s when the idea for Open Letter Map was born — a way to put help requests on a map so responders could act fast. In 2025, I brought this vision to life and reimagined it as Open World Map – Call for Heroes for the Bolt.new hackathon. Open World Map is a real-time, location-based social platform where:      Civilians can issue help requests or report local issues.     Heroes (volunteers or skilled individuals) can respond based on their abilities and proximity.     Organizations can coordinate support at scale.  Core features:      Drop issue markers on the map     Request or offer help with optional visibility     Like, comment, and chat on issues and updates     Post statuses and mission logs like a social feed     View hero profiles with skills, missions, and reputation

projects.title: Polylogue
projects.description: Polylogue is a community-driven platform that helps people learn languages through comprehensible input — clear, visual, and engaging content that learners can actually understand and absorb in context.  Most language learning tools focus on isolated vocabulary and grammar, but learners often struggle when it’s time to speak or listen. Polylogue solves this by delivering contextualized, level-appropriate stories and animations, supported by images, gestures, and native audio — just like how we naturally acquire language.  Inspired by both research in language acquisition and the lack of quality content for many underserved languages, Polylogue is built for learners of all levels, and especially for those passionate about preserving and using less-resourced languages.  Key features:  Visual stories narrated by native speakers  Multi-language subtitles and translations  Community contributions of recordings and content  Support for all languages, including endangered ones  Built using Supabase, React, and FFmpeg for voice synthesis and content moderation  Polylogue is currently in beta — we’re focused on refining the experience and growing the content through user contributions.

projects.title: LaunchPad
projects.description: Recruitment in Bangladesh is so flawed that the students of my country had to overthrow the government in an attempt to reform it.  Entry-level jobs ask for 2-3 years of “work experience”, have sky-high credential requirements (which are often unrelated to the job) and the interview process often lasts for months on end. Moreover, recruiters often favor those from more prestigious Universities or those with referrals.  Employers are always complaining about “not finding talent with the right practical skills” but skilled job seekers in Bangladesh are often overlooked due to the above reasons.  LaunchPad connects employers to skilled talent and skilled talent to opportunities that they have long been deprived of.  Here’s how:  Employers post the job description and a short task that is related to the job, such as making a to-do app for an app development job. Instead of just putting in a resume, the candidate has to finish the task and upload it along with their skill portfolio.  This way, employers can directly evaluate the candidate’s practical skills without any bias. Additionally, this ensures only those with the relevant skills can apply, which means candidates don’t get their application buried by thousands of irrelevant people spamming their resumes on every job. Another problem is that many graduates don’t even know what practical skills they would need for their dream job. To solve this, we used ChatGPT-3.5-turbo API integration to analyse the user’s skill level and job target to build a custom roadmap with skill-building challenges to help them build up their skills & portfolio. We’re not just a job posting site, we’re the leaders of a movement to make hiring fair for all.

projects.title: In Honor Of
projects.description: As July 4th approached, we wanted to create something that honors the heroes behind the holiday — not just with flags and fireworks, but with their stories. In Honor Of was built to solve a simple but powerful problem: most veterans' stories live only in memory, not online. Families often have photos, dates, and medals — but nowhere to bring it all together in a respectful, lasting way.  This app is for families, friends, and loved ones of U.S. veterans — as well as community groups and organizations that want to celebrate those who served. It’s designed to be welcoming and easy to use, even for people with little technical experience.  Key features include:  A guided form to create a personalized tribute  Dedicated tribute pages styled by military branch (Army, Navy, etc.)  Ability to upload photos, write a message, and list medals or achievements  A public Wall of Honor to browse and celebrate all shared tributes  Option to feature a tribute with a donation  Built with Supabase (database, auth) and Netlify (hosting) for speed and scalability

projects.title: CycleWise
projects.description: A woman’s monthly cycle has phases that affect her mood, energy, and stress levels. CycleWise gives husbands gentle alerts and simple guidance on when and how to show the support that truly matters. I have observed how the understanding, or misunderstanding, of emotions between spouses can make or break the peace in a home. In many cases, I saw how domestic tension, even violence against women, often stemmed from emotional misinterpretation.  This got me asking the question: "What if men knew more about the emotions of their wives?" I began researching how much men knew about the emotional cycles of women. I interviewed some married men and asked the question "Are you aware that your wife’s monthly cycle influences her emotions and behavior?" Over 98% had no idea. They were often shocked and remorseful. A common reaction was: “If I had known this earlier, I would have been more patient and supportive.”  This became my initial inspiration to build an app that gives husbands the insight to understand and support the emotional health of their wives. The next inspiration was their willingness to pay a token for monthly subscription (one responder promised to donate to the product), and the final inspiration is that the tools to easily build it was made available by Bolt's hackathon. What it does  CycleWise gives husbands the insight to understand and support the emotional health of their wives. It uses the cycle start date to calculate the emotionally sensitive phase, and sends monthly alert and support tips, a day before it starts. I believe it can improve marriage relationships and help to build more peaceful homes. How we built it  I interviewed 8 married men in an effort to validate the idea, and got them on the wait-list. Bolt.New was used to build all core functionalities till it was production-ready with: Payment processing (Paystack for Nigeria, Stripe for international) Supabase integration with payment status tracking Beautiful, responsive design Email collect

projects.title: Skill Swap - (College Network)
projects.description: SkillSwap is a real-time collaboration platform built for students to exchange skills, form project or hackathon teams, and get help instantly from peers or mentors.  We were inspired by the frustration students face when trying to find teammates, guidance, or urgent support during symposiums, assignments, and hackathons. SkillSwap bridges that gap — creating a connected campus ecosystem where collaboration is just one click away.  It is built for:  Students seeking skill-based collaboration  College clubs, symposium organizers, and hackathon participants  Mentors, seniors, and alumni who want to guide others  Key Features:  Real-time help requests & skill exchange board  Team formation tool for both in-campus & inter-college events  Symposium discovery + intra-college team creation  Project rooms with chat, task board, and file sharing  Mentor Connect for verified sessions  Gamified system with Skill Points and badges  Built using Bolt.new, Supabase, Netlify, and Jitsi API  Prompt used for Bolt.new:  “Build a college-focused real-time skill collaboration app where students can request or offer help, form hackathon teams, connect with mentors, and join symposiums posted by other colleges. Include gamification, team chat, project spaces, and a skill reputation system.”

projects.title: Interview Ready
projects.description: InterviewReady was built to solve a common and stressful challenge faced by job seekers: preparing effectively for interviews without knowing what to expect or how well they're performing. The idea was inspired by the need for a realistic, self-paced interview practice tool that feels like working with a real interviewer. Designed for anyone looking to improve their interview skills—whether they're students, professionals, or career switchers—InterviewReady offers a video-based mock interview experience using Tavus AI, tailored to the user's resume and job description. Users can choose interview types like HR, Technical, or System Design, and receive smart, AI-powered feedback powered by OpenAI GPT, evaluating their communication, content relevance, and areas for improvement. Built entirely with React.js and deployed using Bolt.new, the platform runs client-side with no backend, making it fast, secure, and easy to deploy.

projects.title: MyWayMap
projects.description: MyWayMap is a comprehensive travel exploration platform that combines advanced 3D visualization with intelligent route planning and immersive storytelling. Users can explore countries and cities worldwide, visualize buildings and landmarks in photorealistic 3D, access real-time infrastructure data (hospitals, universities, airports), and experience rich audio-enhanced historical narratives. The platform features global address search, 360° street views, accessibility analysis, and smart route optimization.

projects.title: EchoRoom: A real-time anonymous mood-based chat app
projects.description: EchoRoom was built to solve a deeply personal and social problem: the growing sense of emotional isolation, especially among young people in Kenya and beyond, who often have no safe space to express what they’re feeling. As a generation dealing with social pressure, economic uncertainty, and mental health stigma, many suffer in silence.  The idea was inspired by how powerful voice can be in connecting people—not just through words, but through tone, emotion, and presence. We wanted to build a digital space that didn’t just let people vent, but helped them feel heard, guided, and uplifted.  EchoRoom is for anyone navigating difficult emotions, from stress and loneliness to a need for motivation or hope. Whether you're a student, a young professional, or simply someone needing emotional support, EchoRoom offers an AI-powered voice-based platform where you can join themed rooms like Hopeful, Lonely, Motivated, or Calm.

projects.title: HealthCostBenefit
projects.description: This project, "HealthCostBenefit - Evidence-Based Supplement Analysis," is designed to help individuals make informed decisions about dietary supplements by providing a data-driven approach to evaluating their cost-effectiveness.  The core problem it solves is the lack of clear, evidence-based information regarding the true value and return on investment (ROI) of various supplements. Many consumers purchase supplements without understanding their potential health benefits in quantifiable terms or their economic impact. This platform aims to bridge that gap by applying principles of health economics, specifically Quality-Adjusted Life Years (QALYs), to supplement analysis.  It is primarily for health-conscious individuals, researchers, and anyone looking to understand the scientific and economic rationale behind supplement use.  Key features and functionality include:  AI-Powered Database Expansion: The application leverages AI to automatically research, validate, and populate a comprehensive database of supplements. This involves integrating with external APIs like PubMed for scientific literature, RapidAPI for real-time pricing data, and OpenAI for synthesizing complex information into understandable supplement profiles. It also includes robust validation and cleanup mechanisms to ensure data quality. Quantifiable Health Benefits: It translates the health outcomes associated with supplements into QALY gains, providing a standardized measure of health improvement. Cost-Benefit Analysis: Users can see the calculated ROI for supplements, comparing their monthly cost against their estimated health benefit value. Interactive Visualizations: The platform presents complex data through intuitive charts and comparison tables, allowing users to easily compare different supplements side-by-side. Reporting and Export: Users can generate and export detailed PDF reports or print-friendly versions of their analyses. Supabase Integration: All supplement data is persistently stored

projects.title: LOVI
projects.description: LOVI was born from those quiet, powerful moments when a child looks up and asks a question that stuns you. Not because it’s hard, but because it matters. In a world full of noise, LOVI creates a safe, magical space where children aged 3 to 12 can explore their thoughts, their feelings, and their infinite curiosity, and where parents no longer have to feel alone or unprepared. Whether it’s “Why do people cry?” or “Where do babies come from?”, LOVI listens, understands, and gently guides, offering responses crafted for each age, each moment, each heart. With smart features like a sensitivity-aware question analyzer, thoughtful parent guidance, and a video chat experience powered by Bolt, Supabase, and Tavous, LOVI is more than tech. It’s a quiet partner in your child’s emotional growth. Built with love, grounded in safety, and powered by AI, LOVI helps families not just answer questions but grow closer through them.

projects.title: NutureAI
projects.description: NutureAI is an AI-powered, culturally-intelligent health companion. It aims to provide health guidance that understands and respects an individual's cultural background, food traditions, and lifestyle preferences.  The problem NutureAI solves is the inadequacy of generic health advice and technology for diverse populations. Many existing health applications recommend approaches that don't align with the cultural practices or traditional healing foods of various communities. This leads to a disconnect where health technology fails to serve the full spectrum of how people live, eat, and find joy in movement.  NutureAI's solution is to offer personalized coaching that learns an individual's life, not just their data, by considering their schedule, preferences, family dynamics, and cultural context. It also fosters community connection, creating a "cultural health village" where users can connect with others who share their background and health journey. The core mission is to ensure that every person receives health guidance that celebrates their culture, rather than erasing it. NutureAI offers three key benefits:  Cultural Adaptation: It honors your food heritage by using AI that understands traditional foods, cooking methods, and cultural health practices from your background. Personalized Coaching: It learns your life, not just data, through adaptive coaching that considers your schedule, preferences, family dynamics, and cultural context. Community Connection: It provides a cultural health village where you can connect with others who share your cultural background and health journey for support and accountability.

projects.title: cvstore - AI-Powered Resume Builder with Version Control
projects.description: As someone navigating careers in both Cybersecurity and Web Development, I quickly realized just how frustrating it was to constantly tweak and tailor my resume for different roles. One week I’d be applying for a SOC analyst role, and the next, a web app developer position, and each time, I had to reformat, rewrite, and rephrase my CV from scratch.  I’d often find myself wondering:  Didn’t I already write a better version of this somewhere?  Which version did I use for that last successful interview?  How do I make sure my resume passes those annoying ATS systems?  It was overwhelming, not because I didn’t have the experience, but because I didn’t have a system.  That’s when it hit me: why not build the system myself?  CVStore was born out of this pain point. I wanted a tool that could:  Store my professional profile once.  Let AI handle the resume generation, whether for cybersecurity, development, or something new.  Keep track of every version I created so I could reuse or update them later.  Optimize each resume for real-world ATS systems, not just templates that “look nice.”  I didn’t just build it for myself, I built it for every multi-skilled professional, freelancer, or job-switcher who’s tired of redoing the same work over and over. CVStore is my way of turning my own challenge into a powerful, time-saving solution for others.

projects.title: Promptivore
projects.description: Promptivore is an LLM usage tracker with an eco-conscious twist.It tracks your prompt sessions, calculates how many tokens you’ve used, and turns that into real-world environmental impact, like CO₂ estimates and playful “energy equivalents” (e.g. “this prompt = boiling a kettle 3 times”). I built it because nobody really talks about the environmental cost of AI and I wanted a way to track my usage without guilt-tripping myself. It’s for builders, researchers, and curious folks who want visibility into their AI habits and a nudge toward mindful prompting. Powered by Bolt and Supabase. Includes token/session tracking, impact visualisation, personal dashboards, eco-prompt suggestions, and offset tips.

projects.title: GlowMyState - Tap. Track. Glow. A universal bubble lifelog for your habits and milestones.
projects.description: GlowMyState is a playful and intuitive habit tracker that reimagines how we record daily progress, transforming it from a chore into a joyful activity. It was inspired by the observation that traditional trackers can be discouraging, especially for children and individuals facing developmental or physical challenges. When a user misses a day, many apps highlight the failure, creating shame and making it hard to continue.  GlowMyState solves this problem by creating an emotionally safe space. Instead of rigid checkmarks, users interact with delightful, floating bubbles to log their progress or consciously skip a day without any penalty. This removes the pressure and makes trying again feel natural and rewarding.  Designed for inclusivity, GlowMyState is perfect for children, neurodiverse users, and any adult seeking a softer, more mindful approach to personal growth. Key features include:    Rich customization with over 10 colors and icons to express each day uniquely.  Separate Child & Parent Modes, secured by a PIN for safe and gentle supervision.  Optional memos for reflection, gratitude, or journaling.  A simple, touch-friendly interface with an animated onboarding flow that requires no complex tutorials.  An optional AI Report that offers gentle encouragement by focusing on positive trends.  Ultimately, GlowMyState empowers users to feel proud of their unique journey and find a tracking style that feels truly their own.

projects.title: Dunenet
projects.description: Diseña un módulo completo “Offices” para un CRM inmobiliario multiempresa (Dune). El frontend es Next.js 15 + TypeScript + Tailwind + shadcn/ui, con React Hook Form + Zod para formularios. Modo oscuro/claridad soportado. Arquitectura App Router. Debe ser SSR/CSR friendly (listas en CSR con paginación client-side está bien).  Contexto funcional  Multiempresa: la UI opera bajo una ruta /{company}/configuration/offices (company es slug).  El backend ya expone CRUD anidado por compañía:  GET /api/{company}/offices (listar)  GET /api/{company}/offices/{office:slug} (detalle)  POST /api/{company}/offices (crear)  PUT /api/{company}/offices/{office:slug} (editar)  DELETE /api/{company}/offices/{office:slug} (eliminar)  Autenticación por Bearer token en cabecera Authorization.  Objetivo de UX  Un CRUD de oficinas con:  Listado con búsqueda y filtros,  Alta/Edición en panel (sheet) o diálogo,  Detalle con mapa y datos de contacto,  Acciones en lote,  Storybook de los componentes clave.  Datos de oficina (modelo)  Incluye todos los datos de contacto y geolocalización. Propón el esquema TypeScript y úsalo en formularios y vistas.  Campos requeridos/propuestos:  Identificación:  id (readonly)  companyId (readonly/oculto, proviene de la ruta)  code (string) → clave corta tipo “VA1” (editable, único por empresa). projects.title: SmartHair
projects.description: My wife and I have been together almost twenty years. And for most of that time, she struggled with her hair. She tried everything. Products. Advice. YouTube. Nothing worked. It always felt random. Like a problem no one actually wanted to solve.  One day she turned to me and asked if AI could help. I work in tech, and she was curious about what I do. I ran a quick analysis, built her a routine, and she tried it. And it worked.  She said, “You have to make this into an app. People need this.”  That’s how SmartHair started. It wasn’t about building a business. It was about helping her. It still is.  What it does SmartHair gives you a routine that actually works. You take a photo. You answer one question. That’s it. The app reads your hair and gives you real guidance based on what you actually need.  It’s not about selling products. It’s not a funnel. It doesn’t ask for fifteen minutes of your time. It respects you.  This is for people who are tired of being talked down to. Who don’t want another trendy serum. Who just want to understand their hair and take care of it.

projects.title: NearCart
projects.description: Small businesses and second-hand sellers often struggle to gain visibility online without paid ads, SEO expertise, or influencer reach. At the same time, nearby buyers don’t realize these sellers exist—even when they offer exactly what they need. NearCart solves this by creating a bridge between undiscovered sellers and local buyers, using real-time location intelligence. This project was inspired by the need to make local commerce truly discoverable—not through algorithms or marketing, but through simple proximity. It’s about turning communities into living marketplaces and giving solo sellers a fair shot at success. NearCart is built for small businesses and startups that struggle to get noticed online, second-hand or individual sellers who want to connect with nearby customers, consumers seeking instant access to local products, and communities that care about shopping sustainably and supporting their neighborhood economy. It’s designed to empower the overlooked, simplify discovery, and strengthen local connections all through the power of proximity. NearCart offers a seamless, hyperlocal shopping experience with features like real-time product search to instantly connect users with nearby sellers, interactive store listings that display distance, prices, and product visuals, and built-in navigation using Google Maps for smooth routing. Even without a specific search, users can browse nearby shops through a discovery mode that acts like a live marketplace map. The app integrates essential APIs for location tracking and inventory access, includes secure authentication with external providers, and was built completely via AI prompt engineering using Bolt AI without writing a single line of traditional code.

projects.title: World Time
projects.description: World Time – Global Clock Platform World Time is a multilingual web platform designed to solve the universal challenge of checking the exact time and time differences for all countries and major cities worldwide. The inspiration came from the frustration of coordinating meetings, travel, and communication across time zones—especially for remote teams, travelers, and anyone with global connections. Most existing tools are limited, lack real-time accuracy, or don’t support major world languages like Arabic and French.  Who is it for? Remote teams and businesses working across continents  Travelers and digital nomads  Students and educators  Anyone who needs to coordinate or compare times globally  Key Features Instant search, add, and compare: Real-time analog and digital clocks for any location, with second-by-second accuracy. projects.title: SpeakDude is an language learning platform that focuses on real conversation practice through realistic AI avatars and translation challenges
projects.description: The idea for SpeakDude came from a deeply personal struggle that millions of language learners face every day. Like many others, I wanted to become fluent in English, but I found myself constantly stumbling over words, hesitating mid-sentence, and making embarrassing mistakes. The fear of being judged by others was so overwhelming that I often chose silence over speaking, which only made my fluency worse.  I realized that traditional language learning apps focus heavily on grammar rules and vocabulary memorization, but they completely miss the most crucial skill: actually speaking. You can know thousands of words and perfect grammar, but if you can't speak confidently in real conversations, you're not truly fluent.  The breakthrough moment came when I understood that what language learners really need is a judgment-free practice partner - someone who won't laugh at mistakes, won't get impatient with stuttering, and is available 24/7 to practice with.  Features  AI Avatar Conversations with Luna:  Practice with Luna, a lifelike AI language tutor powered by Tavus  Supports 30 languages Real-time video conversations with natural speech recognition and responses Judgement Free environment to practice   Rapid Translation:  AI-generated sentences with configurable difficulty levels (Beginner, Intermediate, Advanced) Speech-to-text recognition for your responses using OpenAI Whisper Real-time AI evaluation and scoring system Timed challenges to build quick thinking skills in your target language Instant feedback to help correct mistakes  Comprehensive Progress Tracking  Visual activity calendar showing daily learning streaks Detailed analytics: total sessions, time spent, average scores, current streak Session history with performance trends  Built using  BOLT.new – Build full applications just by chatting with AI. projects.title: EditForge Pro
projects.description: Inspiration: Growing up in Rwanda and working closely with students, cyber cafés, and self-taught developers, I noticed a common limitation: most creative and developer tools require constant internet access, subscriptions, or powerful devices. That left many talented people without access to basic tools they needed.  We asked ourselves ,what if creativity didn’t depend on any of that? What if someone could edit videos, compress images, test APIs, write code, convert files, or create documents, all in the browser, completely offline?  That’s what inspired EditForge Pro — an all-in-one creative and developer suite designed to run entirely in the browser, with zero setup, zero sign-up, and complete privacy.  What it does EditForge Pro is a browser-based suite of over 25 tools that work completely offline. It covers a wide range of needs:  For creatives: video, audio, image editors, PDF tools, quote generators, and more  For developers: code editor, API tester, JSON formatter, hash and password tools  For students and researchers: text editor, lyrics finder, Wikipedia search  For everyday users: file converters, QR and calendar generators, screen recorder, unit converter, and more  All tools are designed to work without relying on APIs, external services, or user accounts. Everything runs locally, offering privacy and reliability.  How we built it EditForge Pro was developed using:  HTML, CSS (with Tailwind) for the user interface  Vanilla JavaScript modules for logic and tool isolation  Vite.js as the bundler and development environment  IndexedDB and LocalStorage to store preferences and process files locally  Service Workers for offline-first behavior  Netlify for free and fast global deployment  Each tool was built modularly, allowing them to work independently while sharing a consistent design and experience.  Challenges we ran into One of the biggest challenges was building offline-first tools that typically rely on APIs or cloud infrastructure. Features like Wik

projects.title: AI Resume Matcher
projects.description: Last month, a friend of mine called me sounding defeated. He’d been applying to dozens of jobs, sending out resume after resume, and wasn’t getting a single callback. “I just wish I knew what I’m doing wrong,” he said. That one line hit me — because I’ve worked in the HR space for years, and I’ve seen this happen from the other side too.  The truth is, most job applications never even make it to a recruiter. Around 78% of resumes get filtered out by software — the ATS systems companies use to scan and shortlist candidates. Good people often get ignored simply because their resume doesn’t match the exact keywords or format the system is looking for. They’re not rejected for lack of talent — they’re just lost in translation.  That’s when it clicked. With my experience in HR, I know how the backend works. I’ve seen how systems scan resumes, what recruiters look for, and where candidates often go wrong. So I thought — why not turn that insight into something useful for job seekers? Why not build a solution that gives people real feedback, based on how these systems actually work?  That’s how AI Resume Matcher was born. It’s a simple tool that helps job seekers stop guessing and start applying smarter. You just upload your resume, paste the job description (or job link), and get an instant match score. It shows you what you’re missing, what you’ve done right, and exactly how to improve. If you need help fixing it, the AI can even generate improved resume content or a tailored cover letter on the spot.  This isn’t just another resume builder. It’s built from real HR experience, powered by smart AI, and designed to give job seekers the edge they need. Whether you're switching careers, just starting out, or trying to land that dream job — this tool makes the process feel more in your control.  Instead of applying to 50 jobs and hearing nothing, people can now send 10 well-optimized resumes and actually get results. I’ve seen how frustrating job searching can be — and this i

projects.title: The Mind Share
projects.description: ## Inspiration The Mind Share was born from a deeply personal struggle. For years, despite a history of academic success, I found myself battling severe memory and concentration problems. These cognitive gaps began to profoundly affect my life, my work, and my ability to learn new things. The breaking point came during my professional career; I failed multiple job interviews due to an inability to recall key details under pressure, and in the rare instances I was hired, my tenure lasted only a few days.  Facing this reality, I decided I had to act. I couldn't find a job that could accommodate my challenges, so I resolved to create my own. My goal was to build the very tool I needed—a solution not just for me, but for anyone else feeling adrift in a sea of mental fog. This project is my answer to that struggle.  ## What it does The Mind Share is a cognitive acceleration platform designed to function as an "exocortex"—an external, artificial brain that assists and augments your own. It's built on two core pillars:  Écho - The Real-Time Cognitive Co-Pilot: This is the heart of the application. Écho is a live, conversational AI agent you can "call" for instant help. Using technologies like Tavus, it engages in real-time audio and video conversations. It's designed to be multimodal, audio, live video from your camera, and even your screen share to understand your context and provide immediate assistance. Whether you need to remember a detail, focus on a task, or solve a complex problem, Écho is there to bridge the gap.  Collective Intelligence & Community: The platform is designed to facilitate mutual aid.  Shared Knowledge: It anonymously collects and analyzes interaction patterns, reasoning techniques, and prompting strategies from its users. This creates a unique, living knowledge base that the AI draws from, allowing it to provide solutions based on real, effective human intelligence. AI Chat: Users can engage with various AI providers (like Gemini, Mistral, Claude,

projects.title: Flights Overhead
projects.description: About This Project: Flights Overhead  What Inspired Me  I flew from San Diego to Seattle, then Seattle to Victoria, BC yesterday for a vacation! As I approached each airport, I found myself watching planes take off and land, and wondered: Where are they going? Where did they come from?  That same curiosity often strikes me at home - I live below a flight path and constantly hear aircraft flying overhead. I wanted a tool that could tell me, in real-time, where those planes are headed or returning from. This app is the result of that moment of curiosity.  What I Learned  This was my first time working with both the Mapbox Geocoding API and the FlightAware AeroAPI, and I’m thrilled with how much I’ve expanded my understanding of live geospatial APIs.  I also gained hands-on experience with Supabase Edge Functions, which helped me improve my error handling, environment variable management, and middleware API routing.  How I Built It  The entire application was structured from one comprehensive Bolt prompt that included:  Geolocation and address-based input Mapbox Geocoding to turn addresses into coordinates FlightAware to fetch live nearby flights and calculate the closest one Supabase Edge Function to handle secure API calls React + Tailwind + open-source fonts for a responsive, vintage-style frontend Mobile-first layout with full accessibility, loading states, and error handling Every piece of functionality and design was planned in that initial Bolt prompt. Follow-up prompts were used only for fixing Supabase edge function errors and polishing output. Built With  Bolt (one-prompt workflow) Supabase Mapbox Geocoding API FlightAware AeroAPI React, Tailwind CSS, and TypeScript Fonts: Share Tech Mono, DM Sans

projects.title: Vidyaa.com
projects.description: 🚀 Vidyaa – Learning Made for the TikTok Generation 🌱 What Inspired Us I’m a Grade 10 student, and I’ve been using Duolingo for over 4 years now. Without any tuition or extra prep, I consistently top my Spanish class, just by casually doing Duolingo every day.  That’s what inspired my dad and me:  "Why isn’t the rest of school this effortless and fun?"  We started brainstorming. What followed by days of research and reading on what makes Duolingo click. Chunking, Micro Learning, and Spaced repetitions. What if we took the same bite-sized, gamified learning model and applied it to school subjects, especially ones I and my classmates struggle with? That’s how Vidyaa was born.  It started as a way for me to dogfood my own learning, and has grown into a much larger vision.  🧠 What We Learned Gamified micro-learning works incredibly well, especially for people with short attention spans. (I am the proof.) Students don’t hate studying; they hate boring, one-size-fits-all methods. AI + education = powerful combo. It can personalize, adapt, and accelerate mastery. Building something for yourself first is the best way to make sure it works. 🛠️ How We Built It We started with subjects I study in school, like English, Maths, Physics, etc for IGCSE Class 9 & 10. We broke down chapters into bite-sized lessons, and used AI to generate:  Subjects, Sections and Units with bite-sized courses for learning Smart, spaced quizzes Active recall challenges Personalized learning journeys We used:  React Native for a sleek mobile-first UI Supabase and Node.js backend Perplexity & ChatGPT to generate curriculum-aligned content and auto-grade quiz responses A tutor marketplace for students needing 1:1 help from subject experts Everything was tested and refined using my real class curriculum. I was the first user and critic.  ⚔️ Challenges We Faced Making content engaging and academically rigorous at the same time Building adaptive quizzes that stay relevant as a student progresses Ensuring

projects.title: KBD Guardian — The AI That Stops Dialysis Before It Starts A beautiful, real-time health assistant for managing Kidney, Blood Pressure & Diabetes with AI-powered tracking, reminders, lab uploads, doctor sync, & life-saving analytics — all in 1 dashboard.
projects.description: It started with silence. The silence of a father who missed one insulin dose too many. The silence of a grandmother who couldn't recall when her BP shot up. And the crushing silence in dialysis wards — where every patient started with just a few missed signs.  Every 3 out of 5 kidney failures begin with uncontrolled diabetes or blood pressure. Each dialysis patient costs families and health systems up to $60,000/year. But the biggest cost? Time lost, dignity compromised, and decisions delayed.  So we sat with patients. We interviewed doctors. We sifted through handwritten charts, broken apps, and forgotten prescriptions.  They all echoed the same pain:  “I don’t remember what changed last time.”  “Which app was I using again?”  “I missed my follow-up.”  “I forgot when to take my meds.”  That’s when we knew — data wasn’t enough. They didn’t need another tracker. They needed a memory. A guide. A medical companion.  And so, we built KBD Guardian — the AI-powered health guardian that thinks like a doctor and cares like family.  What it does KBD Guardian is a mobile-first, real-time medical web app that tracks and connects all vital signs for kidney patients, diabetics, and those with high blood pressure — while keeping doctors and caregivers always in the loop.

projects.title: BoardRoomAI
projects.description: The BoardRoomAI is a next-generation decision-making platform designed to eliminate the isolation and uncertainty that comes with facing complex challenges. It provides every user with a personal, on-demand "Board of Directors"—a council of specialized AI personas who collaborate to offer multi-faceted guidance. What problem does it solve? We've all been there: stuck at a crossroads with a major life or business decision, wishing we could consult a team of experts—a seasoned executive, an empathetic mentor, an innovative thinker. But this level of advice is inaccessible and expensive. People are left to rely on one-dimensional chatbots or lonely Google searches. Our platform solves this by democratizing high-level advisory. We replace the single, generic AI answer with a dynamic, multi-perspective discussion, ensuring every decision is examined from all critical angles. Who is it for? This is for the ambitious doers: Startup Founders wrestling with strategy, hiring, and pivots. Product Managers seeking diverse input on feature development and roadmaps. Career Changers navigating the uncertainty of a new professional path. Anyone facing a significant life decision who needs a trusted, confidential sounding board. Key Features & Functionality: Our platform is built around a seamless, multi-modal experience designed to replicate and enhance real-world advisory sessions: The Intelligent Orchestrator: This is our core innovation. When a user asks a question, our backend AI (powered by Gemini 1.5 Flash) doesn't just respond. It first analyzes the query's intent and assembles the perfect team of AI advisors from our roster. It then facilitates a real-time group chat where the advisors build on, and even challenge, each other's ideas to provide a comprehensive answer. Live Group Voice Calls: Users can instantly escalate any text chat into a live, interactive group voice call. Powered by ElevenLabs' Conversational AI, each advisor responds with their own unique, lifelike voi

The inspiration came from firsthand experience—realizing how disorienting it can be to manage severance paperwork, benefit deadlines, and emotional stress without guidance.  The app offers a calm and structured approach. After a short onboarding flow, users receive a personalized dashboard that displays important deadlines (like WARN Act and COBRA dates), a tailored action plan, helpful checklists (based on whether they still have access to company systems), and a dedicated space to log accomplishments for resume-building or interviews.  Built with Vite, React, Tailwind CSS, and Supabase, Layoff Relief ensures user privacy with row-level security and secure authentication.
